src:
YG Entertainment Buka Suara Soal Kontrak CL
07 Nov 2019, 21:27 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


YG Entertainment mengatakan CL hingga kini masih membahas status kontraknya bersama agensi. (CNN Indonesia/M. Andika Putra)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- YG EntertainmentÂ buka suara terkait kabar CL keluar dari agensi. YG Entertainment mengatakan CL hingga kini masih membahas status kontraknya bersama agensi."Kami sedang mendiskusikan perpanjangan kontrak bersama CL," ucap YG Entertainment, dilansir Herald via Naver.Sebelumnya, Sports Today melaporkan CL disebut-sebut memutuskan keluar dari YG Entertainment. Hal itu diambil setelah berdiskusi dengan agensi yang telah menaunginya selama lebih dari 10 tahun.Keputusan untuk keluar diambil setelah masa kontrak berakhir dan mantan leader 2NE1 itu memilih tak memperpanjang masa kontrak.Saat di bawah naungan YG Entertainment, CL debut dalam 2NE1 bersama Park Bom, Sandara Park dan Minzy pada 2009. Namun pada 2016, salah satu girlband generasi kedua terbesar di Korea tersebut harus bubar karena masa kontrak dengan agensi berakhir.Minzy dan Park Bom memilih berpisah dengan YG Entertainment. Sementara itu, CL dan Sandara Park masih memperpanjang kontrak pada 2016.Hal itu membuat CL tampil sebagai solo artis dan fokus mempromosikan musik di Amerika Serikat.Namun, penyanyi bernama asli Lee Chae-rin tersebut tak merilis lagu baru dalam dua tahun belakangan. Karya terakhirnya merupakan 'Goodbye' untuk 2NE1 yang dirilis pada 2017. (chri/end)
text:
YG Entertainment Opens Votes on CL Contract
Nov 7 2019, 21:27 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


YG Entertainment said that CL is still discussing the status of the contract with the agency. (CNN Indonesia / M. Andika Putra)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - YG Entertainment opened a voice related to the news of CL leaving the agency. YG Entertainment said that CL is still discussing the status of the contract with the agency. "We are discussing contract extension with CL," said YG Entertainment, reported by Herald via Naver. Previously, Sports Today reported CL was said to have decided to leave YG Entertainment. This was taken after discussions with the agency that had overshadowed it for more than 10 years. The decision to leave was taken after the contract period ended and the former 2NE1 leader chose not to extend the contract period. While under the auspices of YG Entertainment, CL debuted in 2NE1 with Park Bom, Sandara Park and Minzy in 2009. But in 2016, one of the second largest girl groups in Korea had to disband because the contract period with the agency ended. Minzy and Park Bom chose to part with YG Entertainment. Meanwhile, CL and Sandara Park are still extending the contract in 2016. This makes CL appear as a solo artist and focus on promoting music in the United States. However, the singer whose real name is Lee Chae-rin has not released a new song in the past two years. His latest work is 'Goodbye' for 2NE1 which was released in 2017. (chri / end)
